item.title: C-EP CONSUMER SERVICES
item.description: -- C-EP CONSUMER SERVICES Service Design | 2017, Professiona Work Objective After the deregulation, which direction should the electric power company aim for? In 2016, full-scale deregulation of the electricity industry in Japan has begun, and a lot of new and emerging companies have entered the electricity market. Chubu Electric Power Company (C-EPCO), a Japanese electricity utility provider for the mid-Chubu region of Honshu island, Japan, must shift to a new paradigm of customer service in order to improve its retention capability.

item.title: IBM Watson cognitive enterprise app
item.description: -- IBM Watson cognitive enterprise app Enterprise Application Design | 2016, Professional Work Objective How can MHI engineers make the RFP inspection process more effectively? RFP inspection is important work for Mitsubishi Heavy Industries, Ltd. (MHI) engineers to estimate risks in advance and deliver the project in a healthy way. However, it needs much knowledge and takes long time to do it accurately under the pressure of a deadline.

item.title: Collective Juice
item.description: -- COLLECTIVE JUICE Interaction Design | 2018, Academic Work Objective What is the question that can only be answered by humans during the AI era? Everyday we are googling many questions and we can get answer immediately. Also, recently AI can answer more and more sophisticated questions. However, I think still there are things that can only be answered by people such as fuzzy, real-time and people-oriented questions.

item.title: MTA Metrocard Redesign
item.description: -- MTA Metrocard Redesign UX/UI Design | 2018, Private Work *This project is still ongoing Objective How might we make NYC’s subway riding experience more comfortable? The NYC metrocard system has remained unchanged for decades and users of NYC subway sometimes have uncomfortable experiences especially the entrance of subway; the lost time of waiting in line to buy a metrocard, touching a dirty machine and so on.

item.title: Uber UX RESEARCH AND DESIGN
item.description: -- UBER UX RESEARCH AND DESIGN UX/UI Design | 2015, Academic Work Objective How can we improve the experience of Uber drivers? item.title: FUTURE SUPERMARKET DESIGN INAGEYA
item.description: -- FUTURE SUPERMARKET DESIGN INAGEYA Business Design | 2016, Professional Work Objective What should Inageya do to go “beyond” supermarket? Inagea is a long-established supermarket in Japan. However, in a situation that society and family structures are changing, a role of supermarket also needs to change in Japan. Clients were struggling for planning a strong concept of a next-generation supermarket in 2020 with consideration for a sustainable ecosystem from producers to consumers and of course customer-first.

item.title: LimpiDual Touch
item.description: -- LIMPIDUAL TOUCH Interaction Design | 2009, Academic Work Overview Designed and proposed interactive limpid display with dual-sided touch sensing. I’ve proposed the emerging interactive transparent display named ‘‘LimpiDual Touch’’. Users can operate from the rear side of the screen while seeing both displayed images and their fingers. This feature resolves a finger occlusion problem. Additionally, LimpiDual Touch also works for multiple users. Two users can share an identical display from both sides and control displayed objects at one time.

item.title: Daifuku Experience
item.description: -- DAIFUKU EXPERIENCE UX/UI Design | 2015, Professiona Work Objective How does DAIFUKU build a globally unified brand? Clients thought their website was becoming obsolete and wanted to enhance their brand using current web technologies and user-centered disciplines. And Daifuku has 20 branches in the world, so they wanted to provide global integrated contents and operations. Concept Redesign DAIFUKU corporate website and operations From the perspective of Business, Design and Technology, we designed and proposed from a business organization to UX / UI and an infrastructure.

item.title: Speculative Thinking
item.description: Speculative Thinking Design Research | 2016, Personal Work My Design Policy Speculative Fusion of Design and Science The following chart is my own thought of the speculative fusion of design and science. In the business field, we have been creating probable futures using industrial solutions. Currently, through a collaboration with designers, technologists and business strategists, we can imagine and develop further plausible futures based on emerging technologies. Additionally, we must speculate possible futures that research-level technologies promise, and discuss the cultural and political mechanisms behind them to overcome our 21st-century problems.

item.title: IBM Corporate Service Corps
item.description: -- IBM Corporate Service Corps Civic Service Design | 2014, Professional Work Overview Tackled with a gender violence problem in Mexico and proposed strategies to Protect Victims and Prevent Crimes. IBM CSC(Corporate Service Corp) is one-month pro bono consulting program for developing countries addressing Energy, Economic Development, Transportation, Education, and Healthcare. I participated in the IBM pro bono Corporate Service Corps, addressing social issues in developing countries. I was one of a cross-border global IBM team in Mexico that sought to tackle the problems of gender violence by collaborating with IAPEM (the Mexico State Public Administration).
